49 class Handler {
50 public:
52  Handler(void (*handler)(int) ){
53  sig_action_.sa_handler = (_sig_func_ptr)handler;
54  sig_action_.sa_flags = 0;
55  sig_action_.sa_mask = 0;
56  }
57 
59  Handler(void (*sigaction)(int, siginfo_t*, void*), int flags = 0, sigset_t mask = 0){
60  sig_action_.sa_sigaction = sigaction;
61  sig_action_.sa_flags = flags | (1<<SA_SIGINFO);
62  sig_action_.sa_mask = mask;
63  }
64 
65  const struct sigaction * sigaction() const { return &sig_action_; }
66 
67 private:
68  struct sigaction sig_action_;
69 };

84  int trigger(pid_t pid) const { return ::kill(pid, signo_); }

93  int trigger(pid_t pid, int value) const {
94  union sigval v; v.sival_int = value;
95  return ::sigqueue(pid, signo_, v);
96  }
97 
104  int trigger(pthread_t t) const { return ::pthread_kill(t, signo_); }
105 
107  int trigger(void) const { return ::pthread_kill(pthread_self(), signo_); }

157 class EventPhy: public Event {
158 public:
159 
168  EventPhy(bool persistant, int signo, int sigcode = 0, int sigvalue = 0) : Event(signo){
169  context.tid = pthread_self();
170  context.si_sigcode = sigcode;
171  context.si_signo = signo;
172  context.keep = persistant;
173  context.sig_value = sigvalue;
174  }
175 
176 
182  EventPhy(signal_callback_t context) : Event(context.si_signo){
183  this->context = context;
184  }
185 
195  mcu_action_t action(int event, int channel = 0){
196  mcu_action_t a;
197  a.callback = signal_callback;
198  a.context = &context;
199  a.channel = channel;
200  a.event = event;
201  return a;
202  }
203 
204 private:
205  signal_callback_t context;
206 };
